text: Madama shares; trees don't talk back, they listen. Surround yourself with the peace of nature to center & reset priorities. Be still & know
Madama questions: do our conveniences lighten our stress load if we have to work so much harder to pay for them? Simplify & breathe easier.
Madama asks, what do you fill your head with everyday? Gossip? Trending chatter? Do you know what is happening in other countries? Awareness
Madama notices that there is so much pain in this world. Please don't add to it with rudeness to those who serve. Everyone has secret pain
Madama invites you to help re-fill local food pantries as well as your own. Nurture your community & you nurture your home. Kindness reigns
Madama: write thank you notes to people who never get one: mailman, garbageman, janitor. Life is sweeter with daily kindnesses. Real candy!
Madama invites you to notice your inner critic who says mean things. You wouldn‚Äôt let a friend talk to you like that so why do you? Kindness
Madama invites you to go for a walk, take a breath, and let nature soothe your overwhelm. How can you simplify, & cut your overhead? Peace
Madama is heartbroken after hearing the news in Paris. We need more kindness and compassion in this world.  üíîüá´üá∑ #PrayForParis
Madama invites us into the season of gratitude. Join the movement of family over consumerism. Make it Take-back Friday vs. #BlackFriday
Madama encourages us to keep perspective. Daily annoyances mean nothing when lives are on the line. Get the big picture & buy a new hat!
Remember to thank a veteran not only today, but everyday. #veteransday
Madama reminds us that everyday there are public servants who put themselves in harm's way for us. Honor them and their families. #Gratitude
Madama wonders: if we're worried about bullying for kids, why are name-calling & personal digs okay in politics?Stick to the issues; respect
Madama is tired of crass and rude comments. We are all humans, be kind to one another. Learn more about kindness --> http://t.co/U20heSifEy
Madama wants to talk more about kindness and manners with kids today. RT to start the conversation.
Madama: can you be present with others like the way a baby looks directly at you as if no one else is in the room? They are master teachers.
Madama says you need a day of rest a week; away from your normal schedule. Family time. Visit friends. Rest, Reflect, Gratitude, & buy hats!
Madama is writing new stories to teach kindness, respect, gratitude, & compassion. Are they an excuse to buy new hats? You decide! Soon!
Madama made a new sun hat and one for Peeves. We all need protection but you should have seen the look on his face. Acts of #love & care
Madama hangs her laundry out on a line to dry. Ah, the smell of sheets dried in the sun. Simple pleasures also can take care of the planet
Madama found a beehive in the backyard. What a miracle of nature. Take care of the #bees. They certainly take care of us. Be a good steward
Madama; Peeves kept bothering me. He wouldn't stop. Then, I saw the sunset outside. We went out together & enjoyed each other & the moment
Madama; the world's too hectic & rushed. When's the last time you went to visit a neighbor  to say hi? Put the phone down & bake cookies
Madama; feeling angry but don't know why? There's always a reason & it might be hidden. It's that way for others, too. Compassion & kindness
Madama; frustration happens. Breathe deep & be gentle with yourself so as not to take it out on others. Tough to do. Be #kind to yourself
RT @zoojourneys: If everyone was kind but once, that would be 6 Billion Acts of Kindness @MadamaP
Madama lost her mother when she was young. Some folks never know their mother. Recreate family & honor the present women in your life. Agape
Madama: families need the same manners with which we're taught to treat guests. Kindness, respect, gratitude & compassion for family members
Madama: give your Mom the gift of your time & attention. Chores? Handyman tasks? How about a special day together! Live with no regrets
Madama says; give to your Mother everyday by being helpful in the kitchen & using table manners. Helpful tools in The Basics on iBooks
Madama: give your #Mom a card of your true sentiments, not just someone else's words. She'll hear the poetry of your own emotions. Gratitude
Madama: you might need to mother yourself this Mother's Day. What would be nurturing, kind, and loving for your well-being? Self-compassion
Madama: forgiveness for a Mother releases you, too. Pain is passed on until someone chooses to heal. You could be that person. Compassion
Madama: remember those who have lost children this #MothersDay. It's a very tender time for them. Let them know you're thinking of them
Madama: if you've lost your mother, could you plant a garden of remembrance; a place to go to remember & give thanks? Love's transformation
Madama: interview your #Mom about her mother. The elderly still miss their own parents. Make or learn family recipes. Remember the ancestors
Peeves wishes he could give Madama roses for Mother's Day.  Instead, he promised not to dig up her current bushes. Love comes in many forms
@ketchupmoms This is fantastic! Thank you for sharing!
@AlexStearnCom Yes! You can find it here- https://t.co/qgp0ZGwZyF Thanks for connecting!
Madama shares: all ladies who are nurturers should be honored on #Mother'sDay. You shape our quality of life & well-being. Respect & honor
Madama: which do you choose; the person sitting across from you or the one on the other end of the text? Be in the moment. Show respect
Madama notices so many stressed parents & teachers. Take a breath & let the village help. Master Keys for Kids is wind under your wings.
Madama is aggravated by rude & disrespectful kids. You? Clueless behavior hurts us all including the kids. Doors will shut to them. Ready?
Madama is reaching out; parents, grandparents, & teachers - help with anti-bullying. MASTER KEYS on iTunes May 5th. Teach respect & kindness
Madama made Peeves his favorite dinner.  She lost an old friend earlier that day & wanted to make sure he knew she loved him. Treasure them
Madama: daily choices create your life. #Kindness & #respect towards others & the earth will foster a high quality of life. Eyes wide open
Madama: the climate is changing. Present tense. Why wait for Climate Crisis & the water around our necks to do something? Respect our home
Madama: H.A.L.T; hurt, angry, lonely, tired. Most everybody is dealing with some degree of this. Be kind; you can't always read their heart
Madama: if you waste water its like draining your bank account. No reserves. Water will be tomorrow what oil is today. Respect the planet
Madama: bees are vital to the balance of the planet. Please, no pesticides or extermination. You're killing more than you realize. Balance
Madama: Spring has sprung, time to celebrate the miracle of renewal. Ask & grant forgiveness & see how your garden grows. Oh, buy a new hat!
Madama says; "Shhh, too much rude noise in the world." Kindness & respect are often quiet & gentle. Practice random acts of listening. Shhh
Madama notices lots of eye-rolling, interrupting, & disrespect to elders in today's kids. Don't reward bad behavior with a new cell phone
Madama shares new skills to help table manners, writing thank you notes, & life skills for a balanced child. Skills for their whole life!
Madama invites Sunday school teachers to share lessons in #kindness, respect, #gratitude & compassion. What can be more important? Original!
Madama feels for stressed teachers trying to teach rude kids. Calm a classroom & encourage respect & kindness. Parents & teachers are a team
Madama wants to help grandparents: raising kids to be more respectful. Tough job in a rude world but there's help: http://t.co/1T99zslisS
Madama sends help for stressed parents in teaching manners and ethics to their kids. Yikes, we really need that! Respect, Kindness for all!
Have you liked Madama on Facebook? ---> http://t.co/lLLAYVhy27
Madama bought me new towels & donated the old ones to an animal shelter. She'll always have a soft spot for helping animals. Love you Peeves
Madama's books are now on Itunes! You can learn more about #kindness and #respect here --> http://t.co/2Nkxzh7nbB
Madama is aggravated by foul language. Spring clean your speech & be more creative. Oh, & replace your toothbrush. A clean mouth & #attitude
Madama is Spring cleaning & gave my old cell phones to http://t.co/8ltySbGAdI. Be kind & respectful to the earth. Or, donate & help others.
Madama & Peeves looked up at the night sky: 1 trillion stars in the Andromeda galaxy alone. Don't sweat the small stuff. #Love & #wonder
Madama wishes you Happy Day of Happiness, so declared by the United Nations. What can you do to share that with others? Unexpected kindesses
Madama asked me what "Mean Tweets" were & I let her read some. She sighed: cruel comments from jealous cowards. You've done it again, Madama
Madama agrees with JK Simmons: Call your parents. You are blessed to still have them. Live with no regrets & share with them. Honor them.
Madama: ‚ÄúStay weird‚Äù is the cry of those marginalized & demeaned. They are the spice in our stew, the colors on our palette. Be yourself!
Madama: 70 yrs ago was the raising of the flag at Iwo Jima. Thank a service person today for making your world safer. Deep respect.
Madama asks; what causes are you willing to invest yourself in? Each of us have a part to play. Show your child what it is to help others.
Madama mourns the deaths of #hostages. One who could be-head another is themselves cut-off from their #heart. Help their families to heal.
Madama saw the #Oscars. Is there any room anymore for elegant behavior? Fine clothes are just a costume without good manners. #Respect
Madama: do people understand how much pressure folks were under at the Academy awards? Why mock afterward? How well would you do? Be kind
Madama watched the #AcademyAwards & wondered why some folks bothered to dress up if they were going to talk as if in a locker room. #Respect
RT @Artsbridgegap: @MadamaP We'd love you to join us in celebrating #artsed on Feb 25th! Here is how you can :) #artsedday http://t.co/EhD5‚Ä¶
Madama: How we spend our money shows our priorities. Do you buy your kids things or learning experiences? Spend time with them first. Invest
Madama: How about a new kind of global warming where we‚Äôre kinder to one another? Less storms with rising levels of gratitude. Your choice.
Madama: Are we preparing kids to be caring & contributing citizens or are we focused on creating $$$-makers? What kind of world will it be?
Madama: Are you doing your kid's homework? That's cheating & teaches them to not be responsible. Grades or building character? You choose.
Madama: Are you doing your kid's homework? That's cheating & teaches them to not be responsible. Grades or building character? You choose.
Madama challenges; if you're not #failing at something, you're not taking enough #risks. Trying to be #perfect is a waste of your potential
Madama: to parents; back-off and celebrate your kid's mistakes. They are learning not failing. It's not about you as much as their growth.
Madama; so much pain in the world; wars, hostages, disease, poverty, greed yet the answer is always kindness, respect gratitude & compassion
RT @CKidsNYC: A grasp of manners can help your child get along in the world! @MadamaP's shares some very useful teaching tips: http://t.co/‚Ä¶
Madama shares; whatever transpired, the family of Kayla Mueller needs compassion from all of us. Choose kindness first. Our human heartbreak
Madama wonders;if being rude is now called a Kanye, is being respectful now called a Madama? Pointing that out is certainly a Peeve! Respect
Madama queries; isn't it interesting how much of the news is about folks not being kind, respectful, thankful, & compassionate? Simple, yes?
Madama; such bravery of Larry Stogner, ABC Correspondent sharing his ALS journey. You teach us all grace under pressure. Dignity. #Respect
Have you purchased my book? To make the world a better place we much teach our children #Respect #love and #kindness http://t.co/1P5VgSKdcj
Madama: cloudy days mean a quieter time inside. Rest & creative projects can fill your well back up. Cloudy days are welcome! Peace & quiet
Madama: we repeat mistakes until we learn. Why not learn from the mistakes of others? No judgement, just learning from life experiences
Madama wonders; what's funny to you? Someone falling, getting embarrassed, or getting caught? Can you laugh at yourself as easily? Be kind
Madama offers; you never know the burdens & challenges of others. The choice to be kind & compassionate will never fail you. Hidden treasure
Madama shares; there is so much beauty in this life if we choose to see it. How do you spend your time? Cherry blossom viewing or gossip?
Madama asks: if you draw a line in the sand, you should have one foot on both sides. See things from different views. #Activelistening.
Peeves wanted to sleep in. Madama decided he maybe needed to after being a #servicedog at the #hospital. She offered a warm lap & biscuit.
Madama challenges: start by being kinder as to how you talk to yourself. No insults or name-calling. Be gentle. Be patient. #Kindness first.
RT @NoHoLibrary: @MadamaP Thanks for following us! We love your book theme #PromotingKindness #PromotingLiteracy
@OutpourApp can you follow Madama so we can dm you. we have a couple ideas to work on with you!
Do you believe children should learn #kindness and #respect check out my new book here ---> http://t.co/0yuivBYKRl
RT @WW_Wildcats_206: @MadamaP We earn kind stickers when we are generous and kind to each other, We also like to brag about each other :)  ‚Ä¶
Madama's wait-loss program: Your stress level may not change but how you cope can. Find pockets of peace during the day. All's well. Breathe
Madama's wait-loss program: Don't wait for life to change. For today: choose #kindness, respect, gratitude & compassion. You can't go wrong!
Madama's wait-loss program: Don't wait to ask for help. Life can be very overwhelming. Your calvary might be your friends & creativity.Play!
Madama's wait-loss program: A new year is a do-over & course correction. Choose kindness, respect, gratitude, & compassion. Your master keys
Madama's wait-loss program: "Leave the gun AND leave the cannoli." Make changes with each little choice. An offer you can refuse but why?
Madama's wait-loss program: winter is a time for reflection. Don't wait to listen to your inner voice. It's your oldest friend. #Compassion
Madama's wait-loss program: the news is the same everyday; different players. Be the change you want in the world instead of reacting to it.
Madama's wait-loss program: take bite size chunks out of #debt instead of cake. Lose the burden, gain your #freedom. Interest doesn't wait
Madama's wait-loss program: Peeves didn't want to lose weight because he was afraid he might find it again! Transform why you eat. #Peace
Madama's wait-loss program: no politician, celebrity or billionaire will save the world. It's in your daily choices. Choose wisely. #Respect
Madama's wait-loss program: why are you waiting for someone else to be #nice to you? Start with #kind thoughts towards yourself. #Gratitude
RT @tina_p: @MadamaP Thank you for connecting! Your tweets are inspirational!
Madama shares her wait-loss program: don't wait to tell the people you #love how much they mean to you. Live with no regrets. #Gratitude
Madama asks, do you believe in the value of families? Stay home with them instead of shopping on a #holiday. What is truly important to you?
Madama shares; if you want "door busters" how about going to visit a a shut-in to bring #kindness? Burst through that door and see the magic
Peeves observes; The #turkey's not the only one who has lost his head! Really? Leaving your #family to shop for deals? Come back to center
Madama can't understand why major stores take their employees away from their families on a major holiday. #Greed wins & everyone loses
People of America: #Thanksgiving is NOT #BlackFriday Eve! Please value your loved ones over stuff. Love them with your presence not presents
Madama tears up; please don‚Äôt strip #gratitude from the Holidays.Give your time & care to honor it's meaning. Stuff will rust & collect dust
Madama wishes: put the thanks back in #Thanksgiving. Once lost, how can we find our way back again? Is that what you want to #teach to kids?

RT @2morrowknight: Hold the Door
Say Hello
Smile
Use "Please" and "Thank You"
Offer to Help 
Be Polite 
Pay a Compliment RT @ShowoffByDesig‚Ä¶
Madama: take 10 mins. of your lunch hour & close your eyes. Ask, what is going well today, & what is not? The trends? Ask for help to change
Madama: create a peaceful home in the evening. Fellowship at dinner, less technology, a couple candles lit & go to bed 1/2 hr earlier. Peace
Madama: make a #friend with your journal & save money at the therapist! Have several ways to process & become whole. Then buy a new hat!
Madama: how about being unexpectedly kind today? Give up a parking spot, allow someone to go ahead of you or a surprise gift of cookies. Fun
Madama: perhaps some fresh flowers in a neglected corner will brighten your day & spirit. Respect & kindness to self fills your cup. Breathe
Madama: 26 new playgrounds created, one for each victim of the Sandy Hook tragedy. A tribute transforming great pain. Acts of compassion
Madama: if you pay it forward with frequent acts of kindness, you invest in your well-being & create a chain of good will. Impressive legacy
Madama: be #kind to those who wait on you. They don't make policy, products, get bonuses & are often underpaid. Complain but don't blame
RT @StressFreeKids: Bake Cupcakes for No Reason.
Madama: on any given day some people are hungry, imprisoned, desperate, weary, & exhausted. Don't add to the pain. #Smile, hug, encourage
Madama points out; there‚Äôs nothing noble about being very busy. New ideas & solutions can come when you are quiet or stopped by being hectic
Madama shares: modern folks rarely stroll. Why are we so driven to fill the space in our days? Put the phone down & look up. #Peace be still
Madama read today: there were a record number of #adoptions in England last year. Practicing #kindness might mean sharing your home & heart!
Madama: thank the person who provided & prepared you a meal today. Tell them you appreciate it even in restaurants. It will taste better!
Madama: What is the nickname you call yourself? Fat? Dumb? Worthless? Bullies come in many forms. Don't be mean to yourself. Self-Respect!
Madama: you'll never hear; Does this kindness make me look fat? No, it makes you look generous. Does your mirror see your true heart? Truth
Madama: for today, you will eat, have a home to go to, a bed to sleep in, & indoor plumbing. That's more than most of the planet. Gratitude
Madama: when faced with a choice on how to react, the choice of kindness will never bring regret. Take a deep breath & see the big picture
Madama: Tweets are like sweets; a little bit is fun, too many are a problem. Be sure to tell someone directly that you care about them today
Madama ponders if cell phones help our communication or just make the attempt faster? It will never replace looking someone in the eye. Care
Madama questions, is it kind to tell the truth if it will hurt their feelings? Look deep. Do you need to be right more than your concern?
Madama sighs: George Clooney is married. Just because she's talented, accomplished & beautiful, what's the big deal? Time to buy a new hat.
Madama ponders; extreme weather, extreme sports: couldn't we also offer extreme kindness, respect, gratitude & compassion? True life skills
Madama wonders about our "family values." If we love our children, shouldn't we care deeply about the state of the world they will inherit?
Madama thinks "What's Trending" and who's spending are one in the same. What is our definition of news? Hint: look to your priorities.
Madama: Insult Comedy is tricky business. At what point does poking fun become about shaming? Are you willing to hurt for a laugh? #Empathy
Madama: when does a prank become a hate crime? Are we more concerned with punishment or deepening empathy? Accountability + empathy = change
Madama: there are now cameras in many places but your conscience is constant. Treat others with respect & dignity on camera or off. Kindness
Madama: back to school might mean new school for some. Be kind & make them feel welcome. You might gain a lifelong friend. #Kindness is gold
Madama: why is it edgy to talk about certain body parts in public forums? They're called your privates for a reason. Less crass more respect
Madama: it's sweet that another #royalbaby is on the way. Also, 1/3 of US children live in poverty. Time to focus & question our priorities
Madama: posting nude photos of others is an ethical breach & implies you have no life. What if it were you? Public shaming is for cowards.
Madama reads sweet tweets and leaves the mean ones to the shallow, bored, and compassion-challenged. Is that really how you spend your time?
Madama doesn't get the cloud but wonders why some people can be so anonymously mean on it. J. Kimmel's Mean Tweets teach #empathy. #BeKind
"We need an #international forum to mediate active #listening." #middleeast http://t.co/3yUeehuIIk
Madama lost a dear friend to #suicide. It's a mystery what lies in the hearts of others. #Compassion for their pain embraces it all. Peace
Madama shed a tear at the loss of #RobinWilliams. A bright light went out. We send #gratitude & love to his essence now released. Compassion
Madama loves to garden. Peeves loves to dig holes.This could work out well if done in the right order. Alas, the roses came first. Timing!
Madama chuckled at Peeves watching ants. Do they ever sleep? Where are they going? Why do they work so hard? #Napping is better. Slow down!
Peeves dug a bunch of holes looking for what he had buried but couldn't remember what it was. #Relax. It musn't have been very #important
Madama wanted us to walk instead of drive to an errand. What's the difference between going to the #gym & a brisk walk? Fellowship & #fun
Madama: school is coming but learning never stops. Soon, my books will be out on iTunes. A fun way to learn life skills. Peeves will help!
Madama: #summer is here. Grow a tomato & a #friendship. What a healthy balance! Both need to be nurtured in order to grow. You need both.
Madama: oh how I love being on my porch! Join me & read to the little ones. My #book will be published late this #summer on #iTunes. Enjoy!
Madama: tensions abroad. Are you an agent of peace or encourager of conflict? You choose everyday many times over. What will you be today?
Madama: be aware of the news & the conditions of others but balance it with the many kindnesses & good acts being shown everyday. Eyes open.
Madama: pray for peace but show it in our daily lives. If it doesn't happen in our households, how can it happen in our world? #Compassion
Madama: How come we need rain so badly & the rest of the country has floods? We need more balance in our lives. A giant metaphor in our face
Madama & Peeves sat in silence for a while watching the #summer moon. Not much happening but a lot being shared. #Friendship is dear. #Peace
Madama: are you going through a particularly tough time? Let the simple joys of #summer minister to you. Small things can make a difference.
Madama: Summer is here. For heaven's sake and yours, enjoy it. Lemonade, sangria, concerts, sunsets, slow walks. Self-reflection is medicine
Madama: When's the last time you built a sand castle? Homework; go create one & put your whole heart into it. Home is where the heart is.
Madama: picnics are fun but also require table #manners. Leave the furniture but keep the manners. #Respect your host and nature. Clean up
@paperhaus Would love to talk with you about my books for kids, teaching them kindness and manners. Let's connect!
@CommonSense Would love to talk about anti bullying with you and my new books coming out. DM me to connect.
Madama, you remind me to slow down and enjoy summer with friends. Sunsets, cool drinks, summer moon-gazing. The to-does can wait. Reflection
@CommonSense I want to chat with you about manners and ethics and my new books I have coming out. DM me to get more information.
Peeves woke Madama up when the alarm didn't go off.  Good friends watch out for each other. Small acts of kindness make for long friendships
Madama went to a family picnic. All the usual folks. At some point some will be missing. Treasure simple times together while they happen
Madama tried to imagine what this country would be like if so many had not fought for our #freedom. Show #respect to your elders today
Madama wonders why so many holidays are times for stores to be open for sales. For everything there's a season but not just for buying stuff
Madama invited a neighbor for a holiday picnic. We are a national family & should celebrate together. Be kind to the lonely & forgotten
Peeves doesn't want to be seen at the beach with Madama in her bloomers. Modesty is one thing but BLOOMERS? #Respect what's right for you
Madama made a special hat for the 4th. It's a Yankee Doodle dandy of a design, shoots off fireworks, & shades from the sun. Festive fashion
Madama: celebrate your freedom this week. You are free to choose #kindness, respect, gratitude, & compassion: choices that also free others.
Madama: Send a handwritten thank you for graduation & wedding presents. Much effort went into supporting your efforts. Gratitude & respect
Madama: Please respond to invitations if you are attending or not. Your host is going to a lot of effort & expense. Email, phone, card. Easy
Madama: Please dress up for weddings. They're not a disco but a sacred ceremony. Casual, & too revealing attire insults your host.  #Respect
Madama knows: June is a time for endings & beginnings.Take time to reflect before rushing into new chapters. Write your feelings. Journal
Peeves wishes he were allowed to go to graduations to support friends. Respect your friendships & acknowledge their accomplishments. Loyalty
Madama likes the late sunsets of June. More time in the garden. There is time for slowing down & inner peace if its important to you. #Peace
Madama's puzzled, what's a hotdog? She worries about Peeves who refused the hat she made him. How can you have a picnic with a hot dog? Sigh
Madama wishes you a happy summer. How will you use it? Rest? Visiting? Travel? She reminds you: be thankful & wear a hat! Feathers optional
Madama posted on her wall; bedroom wall & wondered how everyone is going to see what she wrote. Hmm, how do I explain to a 214 yr old lady?
Madama: Jimmy Kimmel Mean Tweets shine the light back on the senders. #Empathy teaches #compassion especially with such an abundance of mean
Madama: only 176 days until Christmas. Let's give kindness, respect, gratitude & compassion this year; the holiday spirit is all year long!
Madama applauds KFC for making a true apology to little Victoria. Compassion & real action is a powerful combination & a teachable moment
